Create BibTeX entry from publication data

Source: R/create_bibtex.R
create_bibtex.Rd

Generates a structured BibTeX entry from a row of publication data, typically obtained from CrossRef or a similar source. The function validates required fields, creates appropriate BibTeX entry types based on publication type, and returns both a structured list of fields and a formatted BibTeX string.

Usage

create_bibtex(pub_row, key_prefix = "")

Arguments

pub_row

A data frame row or list containing publication metadata. Must include: doi, title, container_title, pub_year, and author. May optionally include: volume, issue, page, publisher, url, and other fields.

key_prefix

Optional character string to prepend to the citation key. Default is an empty string.

Value

A list containing BibTeX fields and the raw BibTeX string, or NA if required fields are missing. The list includes:

  • entry_type: The BibTeX entry type (article, book, incollection, etc.)

  • key: The citation key

  • author: Formatted author string

  • title: The publication title

  • year: Publication year

  • doi: Digital Object Identifier

  • url: URL to the publication

  • Additional fields based on publication type (journal, volume, pages, etc.)

  • raw_bibtex: The complete formatted BibTeX entry as a string

Details

This function maps CrossRef publication types to appropriate BibTeX entry types:

  • "journal-article" to "article"

  • "book-chapter" to "incollection"

  • "book" to "book"

  • "proceedings-article" to "inproceedings"

  • others default to "article"

The citation key is generated using the format: [key_prefix][last_name][year]. The function expects the author information in pub_row$author to be a list, with the first element containing author data.

The function depends on helper functions:

  • format_bibtex_authors(): Formats author data into a BibTeX-compatible string

  • clean_text(): Cleans and escapes text for use in BibTeX entries

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# create an input publication row
pub_data <- data.frame(
  doi = "10.1234/journal.example",
  title = "Example Research Paper",
  container_title = "Journal of Examples",
  pub_year = 2023,
  lead_author_last_name = "Smith",
  author = I(list(list(
    family = "Smith",
    given = "John"
  ))),
  volume = "45",
  issue = "2",
  page = "123-145",
  type = "journal-article",
  url = "https://doi.org/10.1234/journal.example"
)

# generate BibTeX with a prefix
bibtex_entry <- create_bibtex(pub_data, key_prefix = "ref:")

# access specific fields
bibtex_entry$key        # citation key
bibtex_entry$raw_bibtex # complete BibTeX string
} # }
